page.title: 04ST. PETERS CHURCH LINKENHOLT
page.content: Linkenholt church is united under one Vicar with Faccombe, Hurstbourne Tarrant and Vernham Dean. In October 1985 the Vicar will be leaving; a Parson from Chilbolton is to take the services until a new Vicar is appointed. In 1871 the present church was built, moved from a site behind the Manor. The old graveyard is now within the Manor gardens. A Norman Font and South Door was moved from the old church. Repairs in 1985 to the Bell Turret have cost about Â£2500. Estimates have been accepted for repairs to the outside walls and the Porch. Money for repairs comes from the Executor of the late H.C.Blagrave, collections at services, covenants and a Sale in June. A new organ, curtains and Bell repairs given by parishoners. The Graveyard is well kept with recent tombstones.
